recommendations.description: OpenShift cluster with more or less than 3 control plane node replicas is not supported by Red Hat
recommendations.generic: OpenShift cluster with control plane node replicas other than 3 makes the cluster unsupported. Three control plane nodes are required because of the etcd cluster. More control plane nodes increase complexity of the system, and could lead to decreased performance.

recommendations.description: Pods couldn't find attached VMDK on VMware node if disk.EnableUUID is not set to TRUE on the node VM
recommendations.generic: The parameter disk.EnableUUID is necessary so that the VMDK always presents a consistent UUID to the VM, thus allowing the disk to be mounted properly. Pods couldn't find attached VMDK on VMware node if disk.EnableUUID is not set to TRUE on the node VM.

recommendations.description: Workloads are using the deprecated PodSecurityPolicy API
recommendations.generic: The PodSecurityPolicy API is deprecated since OCP 4.4 (Kubernetes v1.21) and will be removed in a future OCP version (Kubernetes v1.25). The OpenShift cluster load also increases disproportionately when PodSecurityPolicies are used.

recommendations.generic: OpenShift cluster can get damaged when an operator is configured to 'Unmanaged' state.

recommendations.description: The running OpenShift Extended Update Support version will reach its End of Life in less than 1 month
recommendations.generic: The running OpenShift Extended Update Support version will reach its End of Life in less than 1 month. It will no longer be eligible to receive maintenance updates. Technical support will be limited only to aid upgrades to in-support versions of OpenShift 4.
